import random
import time

class Fighter:
    def __init__(self, name, health, attack_power, abilities):
        self.name = name
        self.health = health
        self.attack_power = attack_power
        self.experience = 0
        self.level = 1
        self.abilities = abilities  # List of abilities
        self.ability_used = [False] * len(abilities)  # Track if abilities have been used

    def attack(self):
        damage = random.randint(1, self.attack_power)
        return damage

    def gain_experience(self, amount):
        self.experience += amount
        print(f"{self.name} gains {amount} experience points!")

    def level_up(self):
        while self.experience >= 100:  # Allow multiple level-ups at once if needed
            self.experience -= 100
            self.level += 1
            self.health += 20
            self.attack_power += 5
            print(f"{self.name} leveled up to Level {self.level}!")

            if self.level <= len(self.abilities):  # Unlock new ability if available
                new_ability = self.abilities[self.level - 1]
                print(f"{self.name} has unlocked a new ability: {new_ability}!")

    def use_ability(self, ability_index, enemy):
        if self.ability_used[ability_index]:
            print(f"{self.name} has already used {self.abilities[ability_index]}!")
            return False
        else:
            self.ability_used[ability_index] = True  # Mark ability as used
            if ability_index == 0:  # First ability
                damage = random.randint(10, 30)  # Special damage range
                enemy.health -= damage
                print(f"{self.name} uses {self.abilities[ability_index]} on {enemy.name} for {damage} damage!")
            elif ability_index == 1:  # Second ability
                heal_amount = random.randint(5, 15)
                self.health += heal_amount
                print(f"{self.name} uses {self.abilities[ability_index]} and heals for {heal_amount} health!")
            return True

    def get_unlocked_abilities(self):
        # Return only the abilities that the player has unlocked and not used
        return [ability for i, ability in enumerate(self.abilities) if self.level >= i + 1 and not self.ability_used[i]]


def choose_character():
    characters = {
        "1": Fighter("Knight", health=350, attack_power=20, abilities=["Shield Bash", "Courageous Strike"]),
        "2": Fighter("Mage", health=300, attack_power=35, abilities=["Fireball", "Ice Spike"]),
        "3": Fighter("Rogue", health=325, attack_power=25, abilities=["Backstab", "Smoke Bomb"]),
        "4": Fighter("Paladin", health=400, attack_power=15, abilities=["Holy Light", "Divine Shield"]),
        "5": Fighter("Berserker", health=290, attack_power=40, abilities=["Rage Attack", "Bloodlust"]),
    }

    print("Choose your character:")
    for key, fighter in characters.items():
        print(f"{key}: {fighter.name} (Health: {fighter.health}, Attack Power: {fighter.attack_power})")

    choice = input("Enter the number of your choice: ")
    return characters.get(choice, characters["1"])  # Default to Knight if invalid choice


def battle(player, enemy):
    print(f"\nThe {enemy.name} appears!")

    while player.health > 0 and enemy.health > 0:
        print(f"\n{player.name} Health: {player.health} | {enemy.name} Health: {enemy.health}")

        action = input("Choose your action (1: Attack, 2: Defend, 3: Use Ability): ")

        if action == '1':  # Attack
            damage = player.attack()
            enemy.health -= damage
            print(f"{player.name} attacks {enemy.name} for {damage} damage!")
        elif action == '2':  # Defend
            print(f"{player.name} is defending!")
            enemy_damage = enemy.attack() // 2  # Reduce damage by half while defending
            player.health -= enemy_damage
            print(f"{enemy.name} attacks {player.name} for {enemy_damage} damage!")
        elif action == '3':  # Use Ability
            unlocked_abilities = player.get_unlocked_abilities()
            if not unlocked_abilities:
                print(f"{player.name} has no abilities to use yet!")
            else:
                print("Choose your ability:")
                for i, ability in enumerate(unlocked_abilities):
                    print(f"{i + 1}: {ability}")
                ability_choice = int(input("Enter the number of your ability: ")) - 1

                if 0 <= ability_choice < len(unlocked_abilities):
                    ability_index = player.abilities.index(unlocked_abilities[ability_choice])
                    player.use_ability(ability_index, enemy)
                else:
                    print("Invalid ability choice. Please choose again.")
                    continue
        else:
            print("Invalid action. Please choose again.")
            continue  # Prompt again for action

        # Check if the enemy is still alive after the player's action
        if enemy.health > 0:
            damage = enemy.attack()
            player.health -= damage
            print(f"{enemy.name} attacks {player.name} for {damage} damage!")

    if player.health <= 0:
        print(f"{player.name} has been defeated!")
        return "defeated"
    else:
        print(f"{enemy.name} has been defeated!")
        player.gain_experience(50)  # Gain experience for defeating an enemy
        player.level_up()  # Check for level up
        return "victory"


def main():

    player = choose_character()

    enemies = [
        Fighter("Evil Warrior", health=80, attack_power=15, abilities=[]),
        Fighter("Shadow Assassin", health=70, attack_power=20, abilities=[]),
        Fighter("Demonic Beast", health=90, attack_power=25, abilities=[]),
    ]

    for enemy in enemies:
        outcome = battle(player, enemy)

        if outcome == "defeated":
            break  # End game if player is defeated

    if player.health > 0:
        print(f"\nCongratulations, {player.name}! You have defeated all your foes!")
        print(f"Final Health: {player.health} | Experience: {player.experience} | Level: {player.level}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import random
import time
def ask_question(question, correct_answer, explanation):
    print(question)
    try:
        user_answer = float(input("Your answer: "))
        if user_answer == correct_answer:
            print("Correct!")
            return True
        else:
            print(f"Wrong answer. The correct answer is {correct_answer}. {explanation}")
            return False
    except ValueError:
        print(f"Invalid input! The correct answer was {correct_answer}. {explanation}")
        return False

def generate_question(question_type, difficulty):
    if question_type == 'arithmetic':
        num1, num2 = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
        operator = random.choice(['+', '-', '*', '/'])
        if operator == '/':
            correct_answer = round(num1 / (num2 if num2 != 0 else 1), 2)
            explanation = (f"To solve division: Divide {num1} by {num2}. "
                           f"The quotient is how many times {num2} fits into {num1}. "
                           f"In this case, {num1} Ã· {num2} = {correct_answer}.")
        else:
            correct_answer = eval(f"{num1} {operator} {num2}")
            explanation = f"To calculate, use the operation {num1} {operator} {num2}."
        return f"What is {num1} {operator} {num2}?", correct_answer, explanation

    if question_type == 'area':
        if (shape := random.choice(['rectangle', 'triangle', 'circle'])) == 'rectangle':
            l, w = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
            correct_answer = l * w
            explanation = f"To calculate the area of a rectangle, multiply the length by the width: {l} * {w}."
            return f"What is the area of a rectangle with length {l} and width {w}?", correct_answer, explanation
        if shape == 'triangle':
            b, h = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
            correct_answer = 0.5 * b * h
            explanation = f"To calculate the area of a triangle, use the formula 0.5 * base * height: 0.5 * {b} * {h}."
            return f"What is the area of a triangle with base {b} and height {h}?", correct_answer, explanation
        r = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
        correct_answer = round(3.14 * r * r, 2)
        explanation = f"To calculate the area of a circle, use the formula Ï€rÂ² where Ï€ â‰ˆ 3.14: 3.14 * {r}Â²."
        return f"What is the area of a circle with radius {r} (Ï€ â‰ˆ 3.14)?", correct_answer, explanation

    if question_type == 'perimeter':
        l, w = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
        correct_answer = 2 * (l + w)
        explanation = f"To calculate the perimeter of a rectangle, use the formula 2 * (length + width): 2 * ({l} + {w})."
        return f"What is the perimeter of a rectangle with length {l} and width {w}?", correct_answer, explanation

    if question_type == 'volume':
        l, w, h = random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
        correct_answer = l * w * h
        explanation = f"To calculate the volume of a rectangular prism, multiply length, width, and height: {l} * {w} * {h}."
        return f"What is the volume of a rectangular prism with length {l}, width {w}, and height {h}?", correct_answer, explanation

    if question_type == 'slope':
        x1, y1, x2, y2 = random.sample(range(1, 10 * difficulty), 4)
        correct_answer = round((y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1), 2)
        explanation = f"To calculate the slope, use the formula (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1): ({y2} - {y1}) / ({x2} - {x1})."
        return f"What is the slope of the line passing through points ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2})?", correct_answer, explanation

    if question_type == 'linear':
        m, b, x = random.randint(1, 5 * difficulty), random.randint(-5 * difficulty, 5 * difficulty), random.randint(1, 10 * difficulty)
        correct_answer = m * x + b
        explanation = f"To calculate the value of y, use the formula y = mx + b: {m} * {x} + {b}."
        return f"What is the value of y if y = {m}x + {b} and x = {x}?", correct_answer, explanation

def math_quiz():
    print("Welcome to the Math Quiz Game!")
    time.sleep(0.8)
    print("When you are answering these questions, The Quiz will not accept fractions.")
    score, difficulty = 0, 1
    question_types = ['arithmetic', 'area', 'perimeter', 'volume', 'slope', 'linear']

        txt_box = Text(root, height=9, width=24)
        txt_box.grid(row=row, column=col)  # Place in the appropriate row and column
        txt_boxes.append(txt_box)

attri_button = Button(root, width=10, height=10, text="Click Me", command=take_input)
attri_button.grid(row=number_of_rows, columnspan=number_of_boxes_per_row)  # Place button below the text boxes
